ArticleTitle.sentence: A negative regulatory region containing a glucocorticosteroid response element (nGRE) in the human interleukin-1beta gene.

AbstractText.sentence: Interleukin-1 beta (IL-1beta) is one of the most important inflammatory mediators in human inflammatory and immunological diseases.

event.clue: Interleukin-1 beta (IL-1beta) is one of the most important inflammatory mediators in human inflammatory and immunological diseases.
Interleukin-1 beta (IL-1beta) is one of the most important inflammatory mediators in human inflammatory and immunological diseases.

AbstractText.sentence: The regulation of human IL-1beta gene expression has been studied for several years, and a few regulatory elements have been discovered in the promoter region.

event.clue: The regulation of human IL-1beta gene expression has been studied for several years, and a few regulatory elements have been discovered in the promoter region.
The regulation of human IL-1beta gene expression has been studied for several years, and a few regulatory elements have been discovered in the promoter region.

AbstractText.sentence: However, little is known about negative regulation of IL-1beta expression at the transcriptional level, which may play an important role in anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive effects.

event.clue: However, little is known about negative regulation of IL-1beta expression at the transcriptional level, which may play an important role in anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive effects.

AbstractText.sentence: We have identified a negative regulatory element located in the region between -685 and -395.
Within this region, a 19-bp nuclear factor binding site (-570 to -552) was characterized by DNase I footprinting and electromobility shift assay.
A consensus sequence for a negative glucocorticoid response element (nGRE) and a transcription activator protein-2 binding site were noted within this footprint.
Functional studies showed a 2.5-fold increase in promoter activity when this 19-bp binding site was deleted in the reporter constructs IL-1beta/CAT and IL-1beta/SV40 promoter/CAT.

event.clue: Functional studies showed a 2.5-fold increase in promoter activity when this 19-bp binding site was deleted in the reporter constructs IL-1beta/CAT and IL-1beta/SV40 promoter/CAT.

AbstractText.sentence: Dexamethasone (10(-8) M) repressed chloramphenicol acetyltransferase (CAT) production by 75% in the wild-type fragment but not in a deletion mutant lacking the 19-bp site.

event.clue: Dexamethasone (10(-8) M) repressed chloramphenicol acetyltransferase (CAT) production by 75% in the wild-type fragment but not in a deletion mutant lacking the 19-bp site.

AbstractText.sentence: A protein of about 150 kD that bound to this negative regulatory sequence was identified by UV cross-linking.

event.clue: A protein of about 150 kD that bound to this negative regulatory sequence was identified by UV cross-linking.

AbstractText.sentence: This is the first description of a negative regulatory region responsive to glucocorticoids in a cytokine gene.

event.clue: This is the first description of a negative regulatory region responsive to glucocorticoids in a cytokine gene.
